nodes:
Usage: nodes [-h] [-u <UUID>] [-s <manage/unmanaged>] [-c <chassis UUID>] [-v <view filter name>] 

	optional arguments:
	-h		show this help message
	-u, --uuid=	node uuid
	-s, --status=	nodes manage status (managed/unmanaged)
	-c, --chassis=	chassis uuid
	-v, --view=	view filter name
chassis:
Usage: chassis [-h] [-u <UUID>] [-v <view filter name>]

	optional arguments:
	-h		show this help message
	-u, --uuid=	chassis uuid
	-s, --status=	chassis manage status (managed/unmanaged)
	-v, --view=	view filter name
switches:
Usage: switches [-h] [-u <UUID>] [-c <chassis UUID>] [-v <view filter name>]

	optional arguments:
	-h		show this help message
	-u, --uuid=	switch uuid
	-c, --chassis=	chassis uuid
	-v, --view=	view filter name
fans:
Usage: fans [-h] [-u <UUID>] [-c <chassis UUID>] [-v <view filter name>]

	optional arguments:
	-h		show this help message
	-u, --uuid=	fan uuid
	-c, --chassis=	chassis uuid
	-v, --view=	view filter name
powersupplies:
Usage: powersupplies [-h] [-u <UUID>] [-c <chassis UUID>] [-v <view filter name>]

	optional arguments:
	-h		show this help message
	-u, --uuid=	power supply uuid
	-c, --chassis=	chassis uuid
	-v, --view=	view filter name
fanmuxes:
Usage: fanmuxes [-h] [-u <UUID>] [-c <chassis UUID>] [-v <view filter name>]

	optional arguments:
	-h		show this help message
	-u, --uuid=	fan mux uuid
	-c, --chassis=	chassis uuid
	-v, --view=	view filter name
cmms:
Usage: cmms [-h] [-u <UUID>] [-c <chassis UUID>] [-v <view filter name>]

	optional arguments:
	-h		show this help message
	-u, --uuid=	cmm uuid
	-c, --chassis=	chassis uuid
	-v, --view=	view filter name
scalablesystem:
Usage: scalablesystem [-h] [-i <id>] [-t <type>] [-s <status>] [-v <view filter name>]

	optional arguments:
	-h		show this help message
	-i, --id=	scalable complex id
	-t, --type=	type (flex/rackserver)
	-s, --status=	scalable system manage status (managed/unmanaged)
	-v, --view=	view filter name
connect:
Usage: connect [-h] [-l <URL>] [-u <USER>] [--noverify] 

	optional arguments:
	-h		show this help message
	--noverify	do not verify server certificate
	mandatory arguments
	-l, --url=	url of LXCA
	-u, --user=	username to authenticate
log: Get/set log level of Python LXCA
ostream: Set ostream level of PYLXCA Interactive Shell
jobs:
Usage: jobs  [-i <job id>][-u <uuid of endpoint>][-s <jobs state>][-c <cancels the job with specified id>][-d <delete the job with specified id>]

	optional arguments:
	-i, --id=	job id
	-u, --uuid=	uuid of endpoint for which jobs should be retrieved
	-s, --state=	job state to retrieve jobs in specified state
	-c, --cancel	cancel job of specified id
	-d, --delete	delete job of specified id
manage:
Usage: manage [-i <IP Address of endpoint>][-u <user ID to access the endpoint>][-p <current password to access the endpoint>][-r <recovery password for the endpoint>][-j <job ID>]

	optional arguments:
	-i, --ip=	One or more IP addresses for each endpoint to be managed.
	-u, --user=	user ID to access the endpoint
	-p, --pw=	The current password to access the endpoint.
	-r, --rpw=	The recovery password to be used for the endpoint.
	-m, --mp=	A list of endpoint management ports, it is a comma separated
			list of properties which includes boolean flag of whether the
			port enabled, port number, protocol. properties should be separate
			by colon
	-j, --job=	Job ID of manage request
unmanage:
Usage: unmanage [-i <IP Address of endpoint>][-j <job ID>]

	optional arguments:
	-i, --ip=	One or more IP addresses for each endpoint to be unmanaged.
	-j, --job=	Job ID of unmanage request
discover: Retrieve a list of devices discovered by SLP discovery.

Usage: discover [-i <IP Address of endpoint>][-j <job ID>]

	optional arguments:
	-i, --ip=	One or more IP addresses for each endpoint to be discovered.
	-j, --job=	Job ID of discover request
